page.title: 16Introduction (part 1)
page.content: Our survey is centred on the village of Daresbury and the surrounding area which is between Runcorn and Warrington just off the A56. The area is mainly farm land, the village is still a rural community despite its closeness to the new towns of Runcorn and Warrington. Best known as the birthplce of Lewis Carroll the author of 'Alice in Wonderland'. The Parish Church has a delightful stained glass window which commerates the centenary of his birth. The window was dedicated by Dr. Gresford Jones, the Bishop of Warrington on the 30th of June 1934. People come from as far as America, Japan and the USSR to visit the birthplace of Charles Dodgson. The local landscape is dominated by the tower at Daresbury Laboratories, Fidlers Ferry Power Station and the River Mersey.
